intro: Stigmatodon lancifolius, commonly known as the narrow-leaved stigmatodon, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes coffee and gardenia plants. The plant is characterized by its lance-shaped leaves and clusters of small, white flowers. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forests or along stream banks. Its botanical features make it an interesting subject for ecological and horticultural study.
